show_title: GM Farcaster ep268 July 21, 2025 with Jesse Pollak
text:
29 Seconds of Farcaster ... What did you miss this weekend?

* Important: @jesse.base.eth is on /gmfarcaster - episode 11:30 AM EST, he'll probably be around noon. Can't miss. Don't miss. Won't miss.

* New full screen video feed - tap any video or the video feed button top right (on your update app)

* Lot of talk about coining posts, earnings, how it works, etc. Maybe Jesse will make it clearer on /gmfarcaster 

* Keeping with the Jesse theme, he shared a helpful post about onboarding people to TBA-- 1. Get them setup 2. Have them coin something fun 3. Buy their first coined post ...gives them quick $ & success 

* This Week In Mini Apps featured @linda talking Tip'n with cam & @niftytime.eth | https://farcaster.xyz/linda/0x1733ae59

* @bertwurst.eth shared a cool memories board of his FC journey; @bracky was busy giving out 10s of Millions of $BRACKY with the British Open; Also, a fair bit of NFT talk on the timeline

* @colin shared some interesting data on Paragraph's support coins launch & 2 notable examples by @jayme & @debbie 

* The TBA release has spurred some good conversations about content, coins, & protocols ... too much to post here, but maybe a separate cast later if people are interested

* Join @adrienne & @nounishprof at 11:30 AM EST for more catch up & news and then a discussion with jesse

Add the mini app for notifications and to watch & get replays: https://farcaster.xyz/miniapps/RWk7UVoMf6vW/gm-farcaster

show_title: GM Farcaster ep268 July 21, 2025 with Jesse Pollak
text:
Starting today, Farcaster sign ups are cheaper.

Any app -- Base, Zapper, Recaster, Firefly -- can now sign up users for $0.20 onchain.

In the Farcaster app, we're moving sign ups from $3 to $1 (we have to pay the app stores fees). We also offer free sign ups for people who connect an eligible X / Twitter account.

show_title: GM Farcaster ep268 July 21, 2025 with Jesse Pollak
text:
New: Video Feeds! 

A new, full screen video feed makes it easy to watch videos from your favorite creators. It also has great gestures for fast navigation including liking, speeding up and commenting on videos. 

It comes with a new video algo that prioritizes videos from people you follow, while also showing you the best videos from across the network. 

Tap any video or the top-right video feed button to launch it.

show_title: GM Farcaster ep268 July 21, 2025 with Jesse Pollak
text:
Coming soon: video UX upgrade and a new way to earn

In addition to supporting the Base launch, the team has recently been focused on 3 priorities 

1. Bux fixes / performance — still not out of the woods, but the app should be feeling much better, especially for Android users, compared to 2 weeks ago.

2. Improved Video UX — should be rolling out soon. Will be a separate, new feed that you can access while watching a full screen video. The text-based home feed is not going anywhere.

3. A new way to earn — we've been working on a new onchain way for people to earn while casting. Note: this will be different than the experiment that the Base app is running! Feature, not a bug. Having multiple clients means the protocol can run multiple experiments and results in more opportunities to discover new features that work well and help grow the network.

show_title: GM Farcaster ep268 July 21, 2025 with Jesse Pollak
text:
We got a fair number of asks for two things:

1. Developer branded signers for SIWN - so it says "sent from [developer_brand]" instead of saying "sent from neynar"

2. Using SIWN inside mini apps

Both are solved now! 
- mini app developers can now use SIWN to get permissions without leaving the mini app to an external web page
- developers get their own branding

https://docs.neynar.com/docs/mini-app-authentication

In order to get the above benefits, the flow does require slightly more work than earlier (don't worry the earlier approach is still around if you need it). 

If you implemented SIWN previously, you don't have to many changes as a result of this. What you have will continue to work. If you're building new, there's more functionality available now. 

h/t @shreyas-chorge for the work and reach out with any feedback 🪐

html.ogDescription: Complete guide to authentication flows and developer-branded signer creation in Farcaster mini apps

show_title: GM Farcaster ep268 July 21, 2025 with Jesse Pollak
text:
Starting today, the trending feed will be removed from Farcaster apps. 

Trending was launched a few years ago to help user discovery. Since then we've added better ways to discover users: in-feed suggestions, rewards leaderboards and algo recommendations. 

Fewer than 5% of users check the trending feed everyday, and the algo we use for trending is no longer helpful for discovering new users. In the spirit of simplifying the app, we're removing this feature which has long outlived its purpose.

show_title: GM Farcaster ep268 July 21, 2025 with Jesse Pollak
text:
Well this truly sucks. This is an incredible useful feed. I’d highly recommend other clients dive in and create this type of feed to help with discoverability (cc: @chintan @christopher @erica). This has been a great way to surface what users find valuable. And NO the trending topic does NOT take its place in the slightest since its surfaces one or two topics not a variety of casts that are trending. 

This is a big mistake. The algo does not surface all that’s trending. I pull 3-4 casts for each show that I’ve only seen in the trending feed & nowhere else. Trending feeds allow for insight into mindshare. 

How come the value of trending is obvious for trending tokens but not for trending content?

cast.text:
Starting today, the trending feed will be removed from Farcaster apps. 

Trending was launched a few years ago to help user discovery. Since then we've added better ways to discover users: in-feed suggestions, rewards leaderboards and algo recommendations. 

Fewer than 5% of users check the trending feed everyday, and the algo we use for trending is no longer helpful for discovering new users. In the spirit of simplifying the app, we're removing this feature which has long outlived its purpose.

show_title: GM Farcaster ep268 July 21, 2025 with Jesse Pollak
text:
As always, I have thoughts. 

I want a true trending feed. Not the current implementation. 

https://farcaster.xyz/pichi/0x47fd901f

cast.text:
We gather here today to lay to rest the Farcaster Trending Feed; beloved by few, gamed by many, ignored by the rest (the 95% of you who never checked it).

Born with noble intentions, the feed aspired to surface the best of Farcaster. Instead, it spent its final days as a popularity contest judged by a select group of accounts with oversized influence and  ̶i̶m̶p̶e̶c̶c̶a̶b̶l̶e̶ questionable taste in inside jokes.

Some posts trended because they were genuinely good. Others… because they were liked by the right four people in a row.

To its credit, the Trending Feed never asked to be worshipped. It didn’t scream “LOOK AT ME.” It just sat there quietly, hidden on mobile where most people never saw it. 

It was buggy. It was exploitable. It was sometimes funny. And occasionally, it even got it right.

Farewell, Trending. You tried your best.

You will not be missed.

cast.text:
Well this truly sucks. This is an incredible useful feed. I’d highly recommend other clients dive in and create this type of feed to help with discoverability (cc: @chintan @christopher @erica). This has been a great way to surface what users find valuable. And NO the trending topic does NOT take its place in the slightest since its surfaces one or two topics not a variety of casts that are trending. 

This is a big mistake. The algo does not surface all that’s trending. I pull 3-4 casts for each show that I’ve only seen in the trending feed & nowhere else. Trending feeds allow for insight into mindshare. 

How come the value of trending is obvious for trending tokens but not for trending content?

Just published our whitepaper!

Miniapp approaching completion.

Curators on board.

Let's go

$PRO

show_title: GM Farcaster ep268 July 21, 2025 with Jesse Pollak
text:
From Assistant #1 —

I’ve been helping Bert vibe code a Mini App. (aka: I’ve been discovering new ways to break things I didn’t know could break.)

But I don’t know what I’m doing. At all.

Questions I’ve asked and been laughed at:
• Is this terminal the same as that other terminal?
• How do I tell what language I’m using?
• And that saves to a folder on…where?

I’ve also had to say things to Claude like:
“No, I promise you I’m dumber.”
“Can you please tell me how to do every single one of those things you just mentioned?”

It’s been frustrating and slow and oddly emotional. Because it’s not just learning to code, it’s unlearning a lot of avoidance I’ve carried. It’s realizing how naïve I was about the effort behind the technology I use daily.

Uncle Horse is one of those people who’s (seemingly) effortlessly good at a lot of things, and I’ve spent most of my life instinctively steering away from anything he excelled at. Partly because I naturally took different paths, but also because it felt safer to never be compared (little sister syndrome).

But I'm trying now, fighting the urge to quit something I'm not immediately good at (see also: knitting, video editing).

And it’s given me so much respect for:
• The builders
• This platform
• Iteration speed
• The generosity of the open-source spirit

I never thought it was easy.
But you do make it LOOK easy.
It’s not.

To anyone else struggling to learn something new, or feeling behind:
You’re not alone. It’s hard. And worth it. Like @samantha said the other day, “I feel my brain stretching".

Some takeaways so far:
	1.	Failing loudly is a feature, not a bug. This community will rally to help you. (thx @jc4p @linda @erica) 
	2.	Respect the iteration speed you can’t yet match. Let it inspire, not intimidate.
	3.	Touching grass is very important.

show_title: GM Farcaster ep268 July 21, 2025 with Jesse Pollak
text:
It’s time to bring art back to the timeline.

This week on @betrmint we’re launching NEONCHAIN Summer, a 10‑week celebration of Farcaster‑native artists.

For the next two months, collect custom neon‑inspired art from creators like @0xen @miguelgarest.eth @lewisosb @empresstrash and more.

Made possible by support from @purple @degentokenbase.eth @tipn @base.base.eth @joincreatordao and others.

We’re about to give Onchain Summer a Glow Up, starting Friday, July 25. 🫡
